intro: Zephyranthes araguaiensis, commonly known as the rainflower or fairy lily, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in response to rainfall. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. It produces a cluster of white or pale pink petals and has a short, stout stem. Zephyranthes araguaiensis is known for its ephemeral blooming cycle, often flowering only after heavy rain.
